page.title: 03GARNOCK VALLEY DEVELOPMENT
page.content: {The Garnock Valley Task Force}was set up to alleviate the increased unemployment problem caused by the closure of Glengarnock steel works. In its 5 years, more than 150 projects were assisted and over 1500 new jobs created, with a projected expansion to over 2800 by March '86. {The Development Executive}took over, a year ago, consisting of a consortium of financial institutions, British Steel, S.D.A. and Local and Regional Authorities. 42 projects have been helped, with a new job potential of 168. Aid is offered to set up or expand businesses in Dalry, Beith or Kilbirnie. As a special development area, attractive financial packages and a wide range of premises are available. Companies training people who are unemployed qualify for generous grants
